links.description: An early example of generative AI art was created by British painter Harold Cohen in 1973. AARON was a computer system that could generate drawings and paintings. AARON produced works that Cohen would then work on creating human-machine collaborative artworks.

results.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Richard Vane, Amblin Entertainment and Hollywood Pictures
end.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Unlike Webbed’s adorable Buddy, spiders in films are often sources of terror. In comedy-horror Arachnophobia (1990), deadly prehistoric spiders descend on a small Californian town, tapping into a common phobia to get audiences laughing and screaming.

start.title: Mothra
start.creator_credit: Ishirō Honda, Kazuji Taira, Tomoyuki Tanaka, TOHO, Shinichi Sekizawa and Eiji Tsuburaya
start.brief_description: Shipwreck survivors found on the presumably uninhabited Infant Island leads to a scientific expedition that discovers a surviving native population along with the Shobijin, tiny twin fairy priestesses of the island’s mythical deity called Mothra. After the fairies are kidnapped by an exploitative businessman named Clark Nelson, Mothra sets out to rescue them.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: Mothra vs. Godzilla
end.creator_credit: Ishirō Honda, Ryôhei Fujii, Tomoyuki Tanaka, TOHO, Takeo Kita, Shinichi Sekizawa and Eiji Tsuburaya
end.brief_description: Journalists Ichiro Sakai and Junko cover the wreckage of a typhoon when an enormous egg is found and claimed by greedy entrepreneurs. Mothra’s fairies arrive and are aided by the journalists in a plea for its return. As their requests are denied, Godzilla arises near Nagoya and the people of Infant Island must decide if they are willing to answer Japan’s own pleas for help.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Mothra (1961) producer Tomoyuki Tanaka was a pioneer of tokusatsu films best known as the creator of Godzilla. He made over 200 films in his career, including crossovers like Godzilla Vs Mothra (1964).

start.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
start.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten and Top Craft
start.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

start.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton, Allied Filmmakers and Walt Disney Productions
start.brief_description: Based on Roald Dahl’s classic story, your whole family will delight in Disney’s juicy fantasy adventure, a wildly imaginative tale about a young boy who journeys to wondrous New York City to fulfill a dream. results.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
results.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

key_work.title: Gertrude Pratt's (Sarah Snook) silver dress from The Dressmaker
key_work.credit_line: Courtesy The National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
key_work.brief_description: The dress shows Tilly’s skill and sophistication, and the superiority of her designs in direct contrast to the bad wedding dress. Inspired by Dior, this dress elevates Gertrude’s figure.

start.brief_description: On a bet, a gridiron hero at John Hughes High School sets out to turn a bespectacled plain Jane into a beautiful and popular prom queen in this outrageous send-up of the teen movies of the 1980s and ‘90s.

end.title: The Breakfast club
end.creator_credit: John Hughes, Ned Tanen and Universal Pictures
end.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and directed this film which was to become the quintessential high school drama of the 80s. Claire, the princess; Andrew, the jock; John, the criminal; Brian, the nerdy brain; and Alison, the basket case are all faced with spending nine hours together in Saturday detention. They begin the day as strangers having nothing in common, but as the day progresses, they slowly develop a bond in recognising that they are not as different as their places in the high school caste system would have them believe. Cast includes: Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, Anthony Michael Hall, Ally Sheedy and Paul Gleason.

links.description: Perhaps the most influential teen movie is The Breakfast Club, which features a ‘makeover’ scene, where Claire (Molly Ringwald) transforms Alison (Ally Sheedy) from a goth to a popular girl. The trope is criticised for projected an idealised beauty standard.

start.title: Titanic
start.creator_credit: James Cameron, Deborah Lynn Scott, Jon Landau, 20th Century Fox, Lightstorm Entertainment, Paramount, Peter Lamont and John Bruno
start.brief_description: 101-year-old Rose DeWitt Bukater tells the story of her life aboard the Titanic, 84 years later. A young Rose boards the ship with her mother and fiancé. Meanwhile, Jack Dawson and Fabrizio De Rossi win third-class tickets aboard the ship. Rose tells the whole story from Titanic’s departure through to its death—on its first and last voyage—on April 15, 1912.

links.description: Shiv Roy’s costuming in Succession is bold but understated. She exudes power through simplicity and fine lines, helping spark the ‘quiet luxury’ trend, which has been exemplified by celebrities like Gwyneth Paltrow. On-screen, Paltrow epitomised the trend in The Talented Mr. Ripley.

end.title: Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles
end.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Lance Hool, Paul Hogan, Bungalow Films, Silver Lion Films and Universal Pictures
end.brief_description: In the third instalment in the Crocodile Dundee series, Paul Hogan reprises the titular character of Mick Crocodile Dundee, only this time the principal action takes place in Los Angeles. Mick is living in Walkabout Creek with his wife Sue and son, when Sue is recalled to Los Angeles to take over her father’s newspaper. As there is an embargo on crocodile shooting, Mick decides it would be for the best if the entire family relocate to LA for a spell. Once in LA, Mick lands a role as an extra in a film, gets a job handling animals on set, goes about solving a murder mystery and uncovers some illegal dealings in the movie business. Mick is typically chaotic with his misunderstandings of the cultural nuances of LA, holding up a freeway in order to catch a skunk and foiling muggers with his bush skills. “Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles” is a fish out of water comedy that relies on reviving the successful jokes of its predecessors in the series. Like the other Crocodile Dundee films, this one panders to gross Australian stereotypes as a formula for comedy. With cameos from Mike Tyson and George Hamilton.

start.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries
start.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation
start.brief_description:
Venture into the opulent world of Melbourne in the 1920s and enjoy episodes of the ABC TV series ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’.

‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’ focuses on the personal and professional life of Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis), a private detective in 1920s Melbourne.

This Australian television mystery drama is based on Kerry Greenwood’s ‘Phryne Fisher Murder Mystery’ novels and was created by Deb Cox and Fiona Eagger. Premiering on 24th February 2012 with the pilot episode ‘Cocaine Blues’, its popularity saw a third series produced and screened in May 2015.

links.description: In Heartbreak High (2022), another local production, autistic actress Chloe Hayden plays autistic character Quinni. Hayden describes good disability representation as lifesaving: “I grew up thinking I wasn’t supposed to exist, and a very large reason for that was because I didn’t see myself represented,” she said.

results.name: Houses that move us
results.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. This constellation looks at the different ways directors and game devs have positioned the home onscreen - from sanctuary, to hostile enemy.

key_work.title: Moving Out (2020)
key_work.brief_description: Moving Out is a chaotic game about a familiar struggle: moving furniture. It’s a fun, family-friendly release; a chaotic co-operative game for multiple players that prides itself on inclusive design.

start.title: The Grudge = Ju-on (2003)
start.creator_credit: Takashi Shimizu, Takashige Ichise, Aozora Investment and Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha
start.brief_description: Suitably scary J-horror that draws appealingly on the tropes of the genre with disgruntled spirits rising to haunt the terrified living. When a young social worker helps out an elderly woman, she finds a young boy residing in a spooky house. Each investigating person becomes troubled by menacing spirits, until a detective attempts to destroy the house. Aping the very successful style of “The Ring” (Hideo Nakata, 1998), Takashi Shimizu engages in elliptical narrative threads, whilst providing requisite scares and thrills. This film is a big-screen re-working of “Ju-on” and “Ju-on 2” two low budget Shimizu films. Cast includes: Megumi Okina, Misaki Ito, Kanji Tsuda, Shuri Matsuda, and Misa Uehara.

end.brief_description: A brother and sister move into an old seaside house that has been abandoned for many years on the Cornwellian coast only to soon discover that it is haunted by the ghost of the mother of their neighbor’s granddaughter, with whom the brother has fallen in love.

constellations_other.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. This constellation looks at the different ways directors and game devs have positioned the home onscreen - from sanctuary, to hostile enemy.

links.description: Ju-On: The Grudge is a famous haunted house horror, repopularising the genre in the west, but the trope has had a hold on our hearts and screens for much longer. One of the first haunted house features was The Uninvited (1944), where two siblings’ make a sea-change – with supernatural consequences.

start.title: Haunted House
start.brief_description: Haunted House is an Atari 2600 video game written by James Andreasen and published by Atari, Inc. in February 1982. The player, represented by a pair of eyes, must navigate the haunted mansion of the late Zachary Graves to recover the three pieces of an urn. The game has been identified as one of the earliest examples of the survival horror genre.

constellations_other.name: Houses that move us
constellations_other.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. end.title: The Grudge = Ju-on (2003)
end.creator_credit: Takashi Shimizu, Takashige Ichise, Aozora Investment and Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha
end.brief_description: Suitably scary J-horror that draws appealingly on the tropes of the genre with disgruntled spirits rising to haunt the terrified living. When a young social worker helps out an elderly woman, she finds a young boy residing in a spooky house. Each investigating person becomes troubled by menacing spirits, until a detective attempts to destroy the house. Aping the very successful style of “The Ring” (Hideo Nakata, 1998), Takashi Shimizu engages in elliptical narrative threads, whilst providing requisite scares and thrills. This film is a big-screen re-working of “Ju-on” and “Ju-on 2” two low budget Shimizu films. Cast includes: Megumi Okina, Misaki Ito, Kanji Tsuda, Shuri Matsuda, and Misa Uehara.

links.description: Takashi Shimizu’s terrifying Ju-On: The Grudge (2003) is a haunted house horror classic – and much more serious than Atari’s adventure game. It uses the metaphor of violent haunting to explore how trauma manifests in physical place.

start.title: Home Alone
start.creator_credit: John Hughes
start.brief_description: Eight-year-old Kevin McCallister makes the most of the situation after his family unwittingly leaves him behind when they go on Christmas vacation. But when a pair of bungling burglars set their sights on Kevin’s house, the plucky kid stands ready to defend his territory. By planting booby traps galore, adorably mischievous Kevin stands his ground as his frantic mother attempts to race home before Christmas Day.

constellations_other.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

constellations_other.name: Neo-noir
constellations_other.description: Blade Runner's retro-futurist setting lends it a timeless quality, while also connecting it to the past and the future.

constellations_other.name: Houses that move us
constellations_other.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. This constellation looks at the different ways directors and game devs have positioned the home onscreen - from sanctuary, to hostile enemy.

recommendations.quote: This legendary Christmas film penned by John Hughes is one of the most quotable films in history. But it's not just a screwball kid's comedy about Kevin overcoming his fears, it's equally about maternal devotion and Catherine O'Hara's Kate McAllister quest to reunite with her son.

links.description: Released in the same year as Home Alone, Atari’s Haunted House positions the house as the enemy. Players must retrieve three pieces of a magical urn and escape without being killed by the ghosts and bats that occupy a spooky old building.

start.title: Inside Out
start.creator_credit: Pete Docter, Ronnie del Carmen, Jonas Rivera, Pixar, Walt Disney Pictures, Ralph Eggleston, Josh Cooley, Meg LeFauve and Andrew Jimenez

video_links.name: INSIDE OUT | Trailer 2 - UK | Official Disney UK
INSIDE OUT | New UK Trailer | Official Disney UK

start.brief_description: Growing up can be a bumpy road, and it’s no exception for Riley, who is uprooted from her Midwest life when her father starts a new job in San Francisco. Riley’s guiding emotions— Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness—live in Headquarters, the control centre inside Riley’s mind, where they help advise her through everyday life and tries to keep things positive, but the emotions conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house and school.

constellations_other.name: Unpacking: domestic intimacy and the coming-of-age film
constellations_other.description: Many screen-based narratives focus on packing up and moving house, new starts and teenage bedrooms, or are entirely shot in one room, revealing what we can learn about characters from a domestic environment.

links.description: Inside Out explores a child’s relationship to feeling at home with sensitivity; comedy Home Alone (1982) takes a sillier approach. Child protagonist Kevin uses his familiarity with his home to defend himself from wacky intruders when his parents accidentally leave him behind on a trip.

start.title: Moving Out (2020)
start.brief_description: Moving Out is a chaotic game about a familiar struggle: moving furniture. It’s a fun, family-friendly release; a chaotic co-operative game for multiple players that prides itself on inclusive design.

links.description: Moving Out (2020) is a silly game about furniture movers – but the experience of moving house can have a huge emotional impact. Inside Out (2015) beautifully depicts the complex psychological experience of an 11-year-old girl after her family moves from a small town to busy San Francisco.

results.name: Pink subversions
results.description: Pink dominates Angela Tiatia's The Dark Current. The artist describes this particular colour as “artificial”, “unapologetic” and “pulsating with feminine energy”. In Tiatia's Sāmoan heritage “there is a brashness in the use of colour. I really wanted to embody that.”

key_work.title: The Dark Current
key_work.credit_line:
Ian Potter Moving Image Commission
ACMI Collection
Courtesy the artist and Sullivan + Strumpf, Sydney
key_work.brief_description:
“The Dark Current has a specific shape to it, that reaches for the essence of a multi-generational experience. One that starts with my mother’s generation, through to mine and on to our children.” Angela Tiatia, 2023

The Dark Current was conceived as a “dream-like visual poem” in three parts that represent the past, present and future. The artwork opens with a striking close-up of a glamorous woman with a pearl in her eye, who is slowly engulfed by water. The artist considers this scene an allegory of the promise that lured her mother’s generation to migrate from the Pacific Islands to countries like New Zealand and Australia in the 1960s.

The middle section weaves together choreographed performances filmed in a production studio with footage of Pacific Island landscapes. It seeks to capture the dark and chaotic feeling of the current moment, as the climate emergency and rising sea levels wreak catastrophic damage across the Pacific Islands and global south.

The final scene is created with software more commonly used to develop videogames. This hyper realistic world is filled with towering ice monuments set atop colourful disco flooring and populated by a cast of performers dressed in pink. The artist describes this joyful vision of the future as “a space of cultural self-actualisation and celebration.”

The Dark Current reflects how we no longer think of the physical and the virtual as being separate spaces, while celebrating Tiatia’s connection to her family history and Sāmoan culture.

Angela Tiatia is a Sāmoan and Australian artist who lives and works in Sydney. She works primarily with moving image and performance to explore contemporary culture, in particular the relationships between representation, gender, neo-colonialism and the commodification of body and place. Tiatia’s work has been exhibited nationally and internationally, and her work is held in private and public collections including Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa; Art Gallery of New South Wales, Sydney; Museum of Contemporary Art, Sydney; National Gallery of Victoria, Melbourne; and Queensland Art Gallery | Gallery of Modern Art, Brisbane.

end.title: The Color of Pomegranates
end.creator_credit: Sergei Parajanov, Elene Akhvlediani, I. Karalyan, Zh. Sarabyan, Marfa Ponomarenko, Armenia Studio, Stepan Andranikyan and Sayat Nova
end.brief_description: The life of the revered 18th-century Armenian poet and musician Sayat-Nova. Portraying events in the life of the artist from childhood up to his death, the movie addresses in particular his relationships with women, including his muse. The production tells Sayat-Nova’s dramatic story by using both his poems and largely still camerawork, creating a work hailed as revolutionary by Mikhail Vartanov.

links.description: Colour and cultural heritage are integral to The Dark Current, much like Tiatia’s favourite film is The Color of Pomegranates, a biopic of Armenian poet Sayat-Nova. An iconic scene shows red pomegranate juice creating a stain shaped like the ancient Kingdom of Armenia.

start.title: Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn)
start.creator_credit: Bryan Unkeless, Margot Robbie and Clubhouse Pictures
start.brief_description: After splitting with the Joker, Harley Quinn joins superheroes Black Canary, Huntress and Renee Montoya to save a young girl from an evil crime lord.

constellations_other.name: Gender avengers
constellations_other.description: Thelma and Louise and Promising Young Woman both celebrate women taking revenge on men who sexually assault them, although victory is temporary as the characters perish because of their choices.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

constellations_other.name: Diamonds are still a girl's best friend
constellations_other.description: This constellation explores the continuing cultural impact of Marylin Monroe’s iconic performance of 'Diamonds are a Girl’s Best Friend' in Gentlemen prefer Blondes (1953).

end.title: Legally blonde
end.creator_credit: Robert Luketic, Marc Platt, Ric Kidney and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
end.brief_description: A lively comedy by Australian filmmaker, and Swinburne graduate, Robert Luketic. Reese Witherspoon stars as fashion merchandising graduate, Elle Woods, eagerly anticipating a marriage proposal from her politically ambitious boyfriend, Warner Huntington III (Matthew Davis). When he dumps her to search for a woman more suited to the role of senator’s wife, Elle sets out to win him back. Determined to improve her chances by becoming his intellectual equal, she enrols into Harvard Law School after her vibrant application impresses the admissions board. Her Southern Californian Bimbo appearance, bubbly personality and casual approach to study set her apart from the other Ivy League students. Initially an outcast, Elle’s blonde ambition eventually secures her reputation as a force to be reckoned with, propelling her to the top of her class. Cast also includes: Luke Wilson, Selma Blair and Raquel Welch. Screenplay by Karen McCullah Lutz and Kirsten Smith, based on the book by Amanda Brown. Cinematography, Anthony B. Richmond.

constellations_other.description: Pink dominates Angela Tiatia's The Dark Current. The artist describes this particular colour as “artificial”, “unapologetic” and “pulsating with feminine energy”. links.description: Reclaiming pink to resist sexism. is also key to Legally Blonde, which follows sorority sister Elle (Reece Witherspoon) becoming a successful lawyer. In the film’s climactic court scene she wears bubble gum pink while defeating her opposition and overcoming stereotypes.

start.title: Barbie
start.creator_credit: Greta Gerwig, Jacqueline Durran, Nick Houy, David Heyman, Margot Robbie, Robbie Brenner, Tom Ackerley, Heyday Films, LuckyChap Entertainment, Mattel, NB/GG Pictures, Sarah Greenwood and Noah Baumbach
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2023
start.brief_description: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.
